intro: Palaquium tenuifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf palaquium, is a small evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its simple, narrow leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically edible and have a sweet, sticky pulp. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact size. Palaquium tenuifolium prefers well-drained soils and partial shade, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical climates.
